org.trafodion.sql.udr

Class UDRPlanInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.trafodion.sql.udr.TMUDRSerializableObject
      • org.trafodion.sql.udr.UDRPlanInfo

  • public class UDRPlanInfo
extends TMUDRSerializableObject
    Special degrees of parallelism.

    Values that can be used in the setDesiredDegreeOfParallelism() method, in addition to positive numbers for the degree of parallelism (DoP).

      • getDesiredDegreeOfParallelism

        public int getDesiredDegreeOfParallelism()
        Return the desired degree of parallelism for this plan.
        Returns:
        Degree of parallelism to be used for this plan alternative (positive) or one of the enum values in UDRPlanInfo#SpecialDegreeOfParallelism (zero or negative).
        See Also:
        setDesiredDegreeOfParallelism(int)

      • setDesiredDegreeOfParallelism

        public void setDesiredDegreeOfParallelism(int dop)
                                   throws UDRException
        Set the desired degree of parallelism.

        Here are some special values that can be set, in addition to positive numbers. These are defined in class UDRPlanInfo.

        • @c ANY_DEGREE_OF_PARALLELISM: This will allow the optimizer to choose any degree of parallelism, including 1 (serial execution)
        • @c DEFAULT_DEGREE_OF_PARALLELISM: Currently the same as ANY_DEGREE_OF_PARALLELISM. The optimizer will use a heuristic based on the estimated cardinality.
        • @c MAX_DEGREE_OF_PARALLELISM: Choose the highest possible degree of parallelism.
        • @c ONE_INSTANCE_PER_NODE: Start one parallel instance on every Trafodion node. This is mostly meant for internal TMUDFs, e.g. a TMUDF to read the log files on every node.
        Parameters:
        dop - desired degree of parallelism (a positive number or one of the enum values in UDRPlanInfo#SpecialDegreeOfParallelism).
        Throws:
        UDRException
        See Also:
        getDesiredDegreeOfParallelism()

      • getUDRWriterCompileTimeData

        public UDRWriterCompileTimeData getUDRWriterCompileTimeData()
                                                     throws UDRException
        Get data to persist between calls of the optimizer interface
        Returns:
        UDR writer-specific data that was previously attached or NULL.
        Throws:
        UDRException
        See Also:
        setUDRWriterCompileTimeData(UDRWriterCompileTimeData)

      • setUDRWriterCompileTimeData

        public void setUDRWriterCompileTimeData(UDRWriterCompileTimeData compileTimeData)
                                 throws UDRException
        Set data to persist between calls of the optimizer interface

        This call can be used to attach an object derived from class UDRWriterCompileTimeData to the UDRPlanInfo object. Once attached, the data will be carried between the stages of the optimizer interface and can be used to keep state. Note that this data will be deleted at the end of the optimizer phase and will not persist until runtime.

        Use this method to keep data that is specific to a query plan alternative, represented by the UDRPlanInfo object. Use UDRInvocationInfo::setUDRWriterCompileTimeData() to keep data that is common for the entire UDR invocation.

        Parameters:
        compileTimeData - UDR writer-defined compile-time data to attach.
        Throws:
        UDRException
        See Also:
        UDRInvocationInfo.setUDRWriterCompileTimeData(UDRWriterCompileTimeData), getUDRWriterCompileTimeData()

      • addPlanData

        public void addPlanData(byte[] planData)
                 throws UDRException
        Attach a byte array to the plan to be sent to the runtime instances.

        Compile time and runtime interfaces of the UDR can be called from different processes, since UDRs can be executed in parallel and on different nodes. If the UDR writer would like to carry state from the compiler interface calls to runtime calls, the best way to achieve this to attach it using this call and to retrieve the state at runtime using the UDRPlanInfo#getPlanData() call.

        The best place to use this method is from within UDRPlanInfo#completeDescription() method, since this method is called on the optimal plan that will be used at runtime. It can also be called from other methods, and the plan data will be discarded if the plan is not chosen.

        Parameters:
        planData - A byte array, content defined by the UDR writer, to be sent to all runtime instances executing the UDR. The buffer can and should be deleted by the caller after calling this method.
        Throws:
        UDRException
        See Also:
        getPlanData()

      • getPlanData

        public byte[] getPlanData()
        Retrieve plan data attached to the UDR invocation and plan.

        This method can be called at runtime to get state generated at compile time.

        Returns:
        Reference to a byte array with plan data generated by the UDR writer at compile time.
        See Also:
        addPlanData(byte[])
